text: Bazigit Atavovich Atajev (, ; born 3 December 1979) is a Russian mixed martial artist and sanshou kickboxer, who currently competes in the Light Heavyweight division of the Professional Fighters League. A professional since 2000, he has competed in RINGS and PRIDE Fighting Championships. He is known for a fierce spinning heel kick and Sambo style grappling. == Early life == Bozigit was born in 1979 in the village of Lower Kazanyshy to a Kumyk family.http://skfo.ru/people/item/732_Bozigit_Ataev/ He studied in the famous in Dagestan sports-dedicated boarding school "Five Sides of the World".http://skfo.ru/people/item/732_Bozigit_Ataev/ ==Mixed martial arts career== ===PRIDE Fighting Championships=== Atajev debuted in PRIDE in December 2002 and suffered his only loss against Dutchman Alistair Overeem at PRIDE 24. Atajev planned to make his return to PRIDE at their final event PRIDE 34 against Gilbert Yvel. However, due to a stomach illness, the bout was cancelled. In 2008, he faced the eventual K-1 champion Remy Bonjasky in his kickboxing debut. He was defeated by knockout early in the third round. He won the gold medal at the 2013 World Wushu Championships. ===Professional Fighters League=== Atajev made his debut in North America on 21 June 2018 at PFL 2 against Dan Spohn in Light heavyweight tournaments. He lost the fight by technical knockout in the third round. In his second fight in the tournament, Atajev faced Sean O'Connell at PFL 7 on 30 August 2018. He won the fight via TKO in the first round. In the semifinals, Atajev faced Vinny Magalhaes, losing via first-round submission. In 2019, Atajev fought Dan Spohn in a rematch at PFL 3, winning in via first-round knockout. On 8 August at PFL 6, Atajev fought Emiliano Sordi, losing via first-round knockout. He faced Sordi again in the quarterfinals of the 2019 tournament, losing via rear-naked choke submission in the first round. ==Mixed martial arts record== |- |Loss |align=center|20–5–1 |Emiliano Sordi
